subject: Have you met the new Microsoft Teams?
body:
You don't often get email from teams@communication.microsoft.com. 
Learn why this is important
Users of new Teams are finding more focus and fun across work, school, and life. We’re listening to the 320 million people who rely on Teams every month and sharing some of the experiences they love most for you to go try. 
 
 
Have you met the new Microsoft Teams?
 
Users of new Teams are finding more focus and fun across work, school, and life. We’re listening to the 320 million people who rely on Teams every month and sharing some of the experiences they love most for you to go try. 
New to new Teams?
As the world continues to evolve, Teams is here to be your modern workplace. Check out the video to learn more about the new and unique experiences we’re building for new Teams.
 
Fan favorites
 
 
Celebrate success using Together Emojis
Foster shared sentiments and a sense of belonging. Simply type (highfive) to initiate a virtual high-five, and your colleagues can join in the fun by typing (highfive) for a group cheer. 
Learn more
Express who you are through Teams backgrounds 
Change what appears behind you in your video meeting or call. You can blur your background, replace it entirely with any image you want, or use a Teams virtual background template. 
Learn more
Let AI filter out the background noise from wherever you work
Working in a busy coffee shop? Taking your call from the airport? Turn on voice isolation to eliminate unwanted background noise and other voices that can interfere with your Teams calls and meetings.
Learn more
These are just a few of the great features that our users love. Visit the

subject: Simple and affordable verification for social enterprises
body:
Hi Melissa,
As a part of the social enterprise movement, I'm sure you're aware of the need for a global standard by which we can objectively evaluate our impact and advocate for a more equitable way of doing business.
That's exactly why I'm excited to share with you about 
People and Planet First
, a verification system pioneered by the Social Enterprise World Forum to unite the global movement of transforming business and building an economy for everyone to thrive, within the means of our living planet. SEA is thrilled to partner with People and Planet First to bring this Verification to impactful organizations and businesses within the United States.
The verification process is simple and affordable, and in addition to building the global movement, offers additional benefits to verified enterprises, including access to tools, resources, recognition and markets.
You can learn more 
here
. If you're ready to begin your application, start by creating a profile with Good Market 
here
. And please feel free to reach out to me with any questions!
Cheers,
Lauren Dekleva Haynes
Community Manager
Social Enterprise Alliance
ldekleva@socialenterprise.us

subject: Curiously Intercultural Monthly Update
body:
You don't often get email from ci@sietareu.org. 
Learn why this is important
Read the latest from Curiously Intercultural
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
Promoting an exchange of ideas among the interculturally curious
Dear Melissa,
Curious about news in the intercultural field and what is going on in the SIETAR community? We have compiled the latest posts from SIETAR Europa's rolling platform Curiously Intercultural for you. We invite you to check them out and join the intercultural conversation! 
Hot Topic: Migration
Published Apr 23, 2024 06:34 pm
We are pleased to officially announce the new Hot Topic for the upcoming months -  Migration, and invite those researching or working in this field to share their experience and expertise with our readers by emailing us at ci@sietareu.org.
Ideas and articles traverse borders more effortlessly than individuals do, and they have the potential to inspire and unite people worldwide by addressing the challenges faced by migrants and creating a happier, more prosperous and harmonious global community.
Read, engage and contribute to this Hot Topic and conversation that are shaping our global society!
The post 
Hot Topic: Migration
 appeared first on 
SIETAR Europa
.
Nurturing Global Citizens: A Family’s Journey Through the World of Third Culture Kids
Published Apr 17, 2024 06:53 pm
In an increasingly interconnected world, the concept of global citizenship has never been more important. My personal journey, intertwined with the upbringing of my children, Alexander and Elias, serves as a vivid illustration of nurturing global citizens. As a family, we have navigated the complex yet enriching path of Third Culture Kids (TCKs), a term popularized by David C. Pollock, Ruth E. Van Reken, and Michael V. Pollock to describe individuals who spend a significant part of their childhood outside their parents' passport countries...
The post 
Nurturing Global Citizens: A Family’s Journey Through the World of Third Culture Kids
 appeared first on 
SIETAR Europa
.
  
More Articles:
FASHIONing Identities Through Cultural Filters
Generative AI and Intercultural Communication: What’s in for the Trainers?
The Greening of SIETAR

Living within diversities. Cultures and new complexities. An international conference by Fondazione Intercultura. Florence, April 4-6, 2024
With our best wishes,
The Curiously Intercultural Editorial Team

subject: Training Industry Weekly Recap 📅 May 5, 2024
body:
Conversation series on inclusive training, TICE keynotes and more.
View this email in your browser
THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
As we continue to explore generative artificial intelligence (AI) tools, it’s important for learning leaders to leverage these tools to be more efficient and effective while also being mindful of their risks and limitations.
Our featured articles offer tips for improving training with generative AI tools as well as addressing AI-generated challenges. Check out 
this week’s selection
 for insights on utilizing AI for personalized coaching and supporting neurodivergent employees as well as tips on how to address AI’s role in financial fraud and a growing leadership skills gap.
We hope these resources will help you make the most of AI and improve your L&D strategy!
Help us improve our content and bring you more of what you need! Send your feedback to 
editor@trainingindustry.com
.
Jenny Ayers
Associate Editor 
[Conversation Series] Inclusive Growth: Strategies for Cross-Cultural Training
Join us on May 16 for 
a panel discussion
 exploring the increasingly diverse workplace demographics and their implications for L&D leaders. This conversation will delve into language barriers, cross-cultural communication and global training trends, emphasizing inclusive training strategies. Our expert panelists from Getty Images, IBM Consulting and Guardian General Insurance will provide real-world insights and practical advice. Equip yourself with the tools and knowledge to navigate the complexities of global training—register today!
Register Now
 
TICE Keynotes: Ignite Your L&D Strategy With Expert Insights
Join us at the 
Training Industry Conference & Expo (TICE)
 next month for a series of inspiring keynote sessions that will redefine your L&D strategy. Geolab’s CEO, Kian Gohar, opens with insights on AI and human collaboration, followed by a keynote panel on day two, and concluding with Dr. Keith Keating's empowering talk on evolving L&D leadership. Don’t miss this opportunity to spark your strategic thinking and grow your network. See you June 4-6 in Raleigh, N.C.!
Learn More
 
You’re Invited! Share L&D Insights in Our Pulse Survey
Help us better understand the needs of learning professionals! Participate in our survey and contribute your valuable insights into the current state of training and development. Your input is crucial as we explore ongoing challenges and initiatives within L&D.

subject: Extra use of TM symbol; insights from EUIPO head, General Court judges and Nestlé; how to litigate in India; and much more
body:
WTR SUNDAY DIGEST
05 May 2024
 
 
Extra use of TM symbol; insights from EUIPO head, General Court judges and Nestlé; how to litigate in India; and much more
 
Everything we covered on WTR over the past seven days, and all you need to know from the world of trademarks to set yourself up for the start of another busy week.
 
Global IP Benchmarking Survey
 
Have your say as part of WTR and IAM’s 
pioneering initiative
 to take the pulse of the global IP industry. 
Complete our survey
 covering everything from internal IP operations to generative AI and registry services.
 
Monday 29 April
 
A new study sheds light on the phenomenon of 
‘extra-legal’ uses of the trademark (™) symbol
, which risks becoming a “source of confusion”, the co-author tells WTR. 
 
Target 
leads the pack
 as energy brands’ stock values rise in this month’s WTR Brand Elite analysis.
 
Plus:
General Court confirms that PABLO ESCOBAR is contrary to public policy and accepted principles of morality
 (European Union)
Anti-counterfeiting efforts in Africa: recent developments in South Africa and Uganda
 (South Africa)
 
Tuesday 30 April
 
Nike and Bape 
settle their lawsuit
, Estée Lauder and Microsoft partner up, TikTok Shop expands in the United Kingdom, and more.
 
We offer strategies for brand protection at 
the Pakistan border
.
 
Plus:
The META dispute: what you need to know 
(Brazil)
JPO finds no likelihood of confusion between KOKO and COCO
 (Japan)
 
Wednesday 1 May
 
Ukraine publishes its 
2024-2028 strategic plan
 and Venezuela announces IP reforms, in this week’s IP office updates.
 
We outline popular 
social media platforms
 worth monitoring in Sweden.
 
Plus:
General Court: Board of Appeal erred in finding that handle design lacked individual character
 (European Union)
Constitutional Court eases procedural burden by annulling key mediation rule
 (Türkiye)
 
Thursday 2 May
 
Ducati, video games and diversification in intellectual property are the key talking points in a 
new WIPO report
 exploring the drivers of innovation.
 
In a special Long Read, partners at gold-ranked law firms in India create a ‘how to’ guide for 
successful litigation
 in the country. 
 
Plus:
General Court finds that Board of Appeal infringed right to be heard in opposition proceedings
 (European Union)
Delhi High Court cancels OTRINIR registration, finds it similar to GSK’s OTRIVIN 
(India)
Ninth Circuit clarifies power of district courts to cancel pending applications in infringement spat
 (Market Insight: United States)
 
Friday 3 May
 
Nissan 
takes on ‘nissan.ai’
, Tesla sues an India-based battery seller, a TikTok boycott ends, and more.
 
Data analysis reveals the most 
prolific copyright plaintiffs
 before US district courts – and their success rates.
 
Plus:
IP High Court upholds refusal to register colours of Hermès packaging
 (Japan)
NUTRIBEN marks granted enhanced protection in BIONUBEN dispute
 (Spain)
 
Saturday 4 May
 
The EUIPO's João Negrão, EU General Court and Board of Appeal judges, and in-house experts from Nestlé and Assa Abloy reflect on the 
future of European trademark, copyright and design law
, at the fifth EUIPO IP Case Law Conference.
 
Special Report
 
WTR’s 
latest Special Report
 examines the future of 
brand protection on social media
, offering insights and strategies to help brand owners mitigate the risks and seize new opportunities for brand growth in an evolving digital world.
 
Subscribe
Follow on
 
 
Follow on

subject: ⏰ 30 Days to TICE – Are You Ready to Be Inspired?
body:
Join us for keynotes that will redefine your L&D strategy.
View this email in your browser
.
 
The countdown is on! ONE MONTH TO GO! 🎉
The Training Industry Conference & Expo (TICE)
 is just 30 days away! Get ready to kick off each day with transformative 
keynote sessions
 designed to spark your strategic thinking and set the tone for the rest of the conference.
REGISTER NOW
 
DAY ONE
The Future of Human-AI Collaboration
Kian Gohar, CEO and Founder of Geolab
Redefine the role of artificial intelligence (AI) in learning and development (L&D) with Kian Gohar for his opening keynote session on "The Future of Human-AI Collaboration." Discover firsthand how AI can enhance human capabilities and create more impactful learning experiences.
DAY TWO
Panel Discussion
AI In Action: How New Tech Is Transforming L&D
Our group of seasoned L&D professionals will share their insights and real-world experiences on leveraging AI in their work. From content creation and personalization to coaching and administrative support, discover how AI is impacting the L&D landscape.
DAY THREE
Evolve. Or Else. The Path to Becoming Trusted Learning Advisors.
Dr. Keith Keating, Chief Learning Officer of BDO
For too long, learning leaders have felt like order-takers, implementing learning programs from those outside the training function in their organization. Join Dr. Keith Keating's keynote session to discover how you can go from order taker to innovator and elevate your role as a learning leader within your organization.
Join us June 4-6 in Raleigh, N.C. for three days filled with learning, connections and growth! We can’t wait to welcome you!
 
  
REGISTER NOW

Hi Melissa,
  
Are you currently using a platform to support your training programs, or are you considering acquiring one?

At Promote we believe that the effectiveness of learning initiatives largely depends on their real-world application and participant engagement.

I would be delighted to demonstrate how our platform can address the specific needs of your organization. 
Could we arrange a brief conversation or a demonstration session at your convenience with me or one of my colleagues?

subject: Risk of confusion over TM symbol; give us your thoughts; Lawful Use rule under fire
body:
02 May 2024 
 
Editor's Round-Up
A new study has shed light on the phenomenon of 
‘extra-legal’ uses of the trademark (™) symbol
. Analysis of how non-commercial entities use the symbol in everyday digital interactions – ranging from parody to general informal use – uncovers a risk of it becoming a “source of confusion”, the study’s co-author tells WTR.
 
Elsewhere, WTR and sister platform IAM 
have launched
 the new Global IP Benchmarking Survey, which aims to take the pulse of the global IP industry on everything from internal practice operations to national registry services. Take five minutes to complete 
the anonymous survey
 today.

body:

 From Day One is pleased to invite you to our upcoming events, each accredited by SHRM and HRCI, unless otherwise noted.
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
From Day One is pleased to invite you to our upcoming events
Our weekly 
webinars
 are each 60 minutes, complimentary to attend, and qualify for 1 credit from SHRM and HRCI.
Our monthly half-day 
virtual conferences 
include keynote, fireside chat, and panel discussions on our virtual main stage, as well as workshop sessions, chat, and one-on-one networking opportunities that facilitate interaction with our presenters and your fellow participants. They each qualify for 3 credits from SHRM and HRCI.
Our 
live events
 are coming to a city near you. Each one-day conference brings together leading thinkers and top executives in HR, talent acquisition, diversity, employee engagement, benefits, and CSR for an engaging, up-to-the-minute conversation about how employers can build stronger bonds of trust and connection with their workers and their communities. They each qualify for 4 credits from SHRM and HRCI.
Our 
half-day live events
 bring together leading thinkers and top executives in more focused sectors. They each qualify for 3 credits from SHRM and HRCI. 
WEBINAR
 
May 1: Building an Effective Talent Strategy for the Skills of the Future: a Case Study
The world of work keeps changing. This creates a challenging environment for organizations to hire and develop people with the right skills, at scale. In fact, 77% of talent leaders said in a survey that their strategy is more focused on agility this year, an 11% increase from last year. So, is your business hiring and mobilizing for the future of work? Join us for a fireside chat with Andy Nelesen, Global Head of Talent Acquisition Solutions at SHL, and Richard Chambers, Ph.D., Talent Director at General Mills, as they explore how enterprising organizations are embracing skills to maximize their hiring, talent management, and careers strategies. 
Register now
WEBINAR
 
May 6: Intentional Recruiting: Bridging Business Goals with Human-Centric Hiring to Impact the Bottom Line
Recruiting the best possible workforce for your organization requires collaborating with leadership to achieve clear business goals. Discover how HR teams can elevate hiring practice in service of your company's long-term vision. In this webinar, you'll learn how innovative hiring techniques, technology, and data integration practices can establish your HR team as an essential contributor to overall business success.
Register
 
now
WEBINAR
 
May 8: The Secrets to Boosting Remote-Team Productivity and Performance
To attract talent, employers need to offer remote and hybrid work, yet also need to create innovative arrangements that work for both the individual employees and the organization. Employees tend to think they're more productive working from home, yet research indicates that's not always the case. How to bridge the gap and ensure optimal performance? During this webcast, experts from ActivTrak will explore findings from more than 9,500 customers. As well as dashboards for measuring and improving productivity in the workplace. You’ll learn how to use these sources and tools to:
- Measure and improve productivity across teams and individuals using industry benchmarks
- Drive effective coaching conversations to maximize efficiency
- Quickly spot signs of disengagement and burnout
- Ensure optimal work balance among teams and individuals
- Identify opportunities for performance improvement 
Register now
WEBINAR
 
May 13: Retention is the New Recruiting: Strategies to Build and Keep a High-performing Workforce
Join Phil Willburn, VP of People Analytics and Greg Anderson, Principal Product Marketer at Workday as they share research and insights from Workday’s latest hiring and talent trends report. Trends in hiring reflect more than the state of the economy. They also reflect attitudes toward work, workforce mobility, and which industries are poised to weather future labor market shifts. Metrics from Workday customers indicate the hiring slowdown may be coming to an end. This webinar will explore how that impacts organizations’ talent strategies and why that makes “retaining” the new “recruiting.” Workday will also pull back the curtain and share how they apply their own technology and best practices about talent and performance philosophy, internal mobility, and flex work.
Register
 
now
LIVE EVENT
 
May 14: Minneapolis, MN - Building a Culture for Workers and Companies to Thrive in Times of Change
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. How can companies do more with less, while maintaining employee well-being? What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now
WEBINAR
 
May 15: Reducing Healthcare Costs by Reversing Chronic Care Conditions
With 60 percent of American adults living with chronic conditions like heart disease and diabetes, the stakes for effective healthcare management have never been higher. These persistent diseases demand continuous medical attention, impacting daily life and work productivity. They are not only leading causes of death in the U.S. but also major drivers of the nation's staggering $4.1 trillion annual healthcare costs. For employers, this presents a critical and unparalleled opportunity to transform this challenge into a strategic advantage. This 60-minute webinar offers invaluable insights into navigating and mitigating the financial impact of chronic diseases on your business, all while fostering a healthier, more productive workforce. Key Highlights of the Webinar:
- Hear directly from two esteemed physicians at the forefront of battling chronic diseases, reversing these conditions through innovative approaches.
- Discover how digital health point solutions can be leveraged to monitor health metrics, encourage healthier lifestyle choices, and facilitate effective disease management.
- Understand how building a strong patient-doctor relationship can be a cornerstone in preventing and managing chronic conditions.
Register
 
now
WEBINAR
 
May 21: Excellence in Hiring: Designing the Optimal Employee-Selection Process
Designing an effective selection process is crucial for attracting and retaining top talent. This webinar will explore the key components of a successful selection process, from defining job requirements to evaluating candidates and making the final decision. Experts from Fountain, a high-volume hiring platform, will discuss how to leverage technology and data to streamline the process, as well as how to ensure that your selection criteria align with your organization’s values and goals. Whether you’re a seasoned HR professional or new to the field, this conversation will provide valuable insights and best practices for setting up a selection process that drives success for your organization. Join us to learn how to build a talent-acquisition strategy that helps you identify, hire, and retain the best candidates for your team. 
Register now
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
May 22: The Art and Science of Employee Retention, Coaching and Advancement
While the pace of job-hopping has eased, employers have a powerful motivation to retain skilled workers, both for financial and cultural reasons. How can employers use new tools, including AI, to gain insights about what’s inspiring their workers to stay committed–or walk out the door? Since attrition is often caused by poor relationships with managers, what are innovative ways for employers to train their workers to be better leaders at a time when workers have higher expectations for job satisfaction? How can technology help make coaching more effective? 
Register now
LIVE EVENT
 
May 23: Manhattan, NY - Building a Culture for Workers and Companies to Thrive in Times of Change
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. How can companies do more with less, while maintaining employee well-being? What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now
WEBINAR
 
May 30: Hiring Developers: How to Build a Nearly Perfect Tech-Recruitment Process
Realistic, fair, fast, engaging, effective, precise, structured, memorable, collaborative, skills-based, inclusive–can your tech-recruitment process have it all? When hiring developers, is there really such a thing as the perfect process? Probably not. But, this webinar can help you get close. Join our panel of expert speakers as they explore what an optimal tech-hiring process looks like and share real-life examples of the good and the bad. Ask your own questions during a live Q&A and leverage our experts’ experience and lessons learned to improve the way you hire developers.
Register now
WEBINAR
 
June 4: Paving the Way for All Paths to Parenthood
Studies indicate that 29% of LGBTQ+ couples are raising children, and 63% of millennial LGBTQ+ couples are hoping to expand their family in the near future. But, surrogacy typically costs $60-100k per child. If your current family building benefits aren’t built to support these expenses and every path to parenthood, they may not be inclusive enough to meet your DEIB, retention or talent acquisition goals. Join this webinar to learn how to evolve your benefits to be more inclusive, and ways to support surrogacy, egg/sperm donorship, adoption/fostering. 
Register now
WEBINAR
 
June 11: High-Performance Culture: Creating a Workplace Where People and Productivity Thrive
In today's ever-changing world of work, a high-performance culture that’s both adaptable and resilient is the key to not just surviving, but thriving. Join us for a deep dive into Arbinger's latest research, where we'll explore how to cultivate excellence through a culture that fosters innovation, bounces back from challenges, and produces exceptional results—even with limited resources.
Register
 
now
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
June 12: 
Bringing Talent Acquisition into the Digital Age
Despite layoffs making headlines now, all the demographic and digital trends point toward tough competition for workers in the future–maybe sooner than most expect. What are the new techniques and tools that talent-acquisition can use to envision the workforce their company will need in the future? What data and insights can HR and TA leaders provide to the company to be ahead of trends? How can companies do a better job of internal recruiting and promoting internal mobility? What are the best practices for hiring based on skills and potential, rather than credentials? 
Register now
WEBINAR
 
June 13: Evaluating Financial Wellbeing Programs: How to Choose the Best Solution for Your Workforce
Financial wellbeing has quickly become the #1 workplace benefit for US and global organizations. How can employers evaluate financial wellbeing solutions to fit their unique needs? This engaging panel discussion will provide actionable approaches to assess and select programs tailored to meet the diverse needs of your workforce. Hosted by industry experts, this session will empower benefits decision-makers with the tools to evaluate financial wellbeing program features, cost-effectiveness, and measurable outcomes. The result is a financial wellbeing roadmap aligned with employer goals to foster workplace financial resilience.
Register now
LIVE EVENT
 
June 13: San Francisco, CA - Building a Culture for Workers and Companies to Thrive in Times of Change
In an era of digital transformation and rising employee expectations, companies will need to become even more attuned to the needs and aspirations of workers to keep them engaged and satisfied on their career paths. And in an environment of hybrid work and strained profits, employers will have to focus on making work both efficient and sustainable. What are the next frontiers in talent acquisition, employee benefits, learning and development, and diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging? 
Register now
WEBINAR
 
June 18: The ROI of Employee Experience: Recent Research and Best Practices
As HR invests into improving the employee experience, it's critical to understand the impact of those investments. Delve into the insights from our 2024 HR research featuring inputs from over 1,000 HR leaders to see the crucial link between positive return on investment (ROI) and strategic investments in employee experience. Learn what key HR technologies companies are investing in this year that have the largest influence on seeing ROI and how to think about and present ROI proof to your colleagues and executive team.
Register now
WEBINAR
 
June 20: How to Transform Your Organization into a Skills-Based Powerhouse
With business priorities changing quickly and often, it can feel impossible to keep up with talent demands. Organizing work around people and their skills can maximize agility, productivity, and performance. Be part of the growing population of talent leaders moving their organization towards a skills-based approach. This session is designed to guide leaders and HR professionals through the process of becoming a skills-centric organization. Join the discussion on:
- The value of a skills-based approach
- How to get started
- Best practices in integrating skills assessment into recruitment, mobility and talent development
- How to gain alignment across key stakeholders
Register now
WEBINAR
 
June 25: Boosting Financial Wellness by Helping Employees Meet Their Everyday Needs
When workers struggle to make ends meet between paychecks, they often turn to costly solutions like payday loans and credit-card debt. Yet employee benefits such as Earned Wage Access can give them quicker access to the money they need to pay bills, avoid late fees, and meet unexpected expenses. Join our webinar to learn how employers can give their workers more control over how and when they get paid–and how this can reduce employee stress, boost productivity, and help companies attract and retain their workers.
Register now
WEBINAR
 
June 26: Redefining Recruitment: The Advantages and Challenges of Skills-Based Hiring
Skills-based hiring can be an effective way to expand the talent pool, reduce turnover, and improve overall performance when hiring an hourly workforce. What strategies can leaders employ to effectively identify and prioritize the specific skills required for their workforce, particularly when considering hourly positions? What are the key benefits of adopting a skills-based hiring approach over traditional methods, and what are the challenges to getting there? How can leaders ensure hiring managers have the education and tools to properly conduct a skills-based interview and approach? 
Register now
WEBINAR
 
July 2: Treating Substance Use With a Dedicated Program: A Case Study on the ROI of Compassionate Care ?
Substance-use disorder (SUD) is a top cost driver for employers, according to the largest study of substance-use treatment by the Centers for Disease Control. As a result, employers increasingly are seeking to incorporate SUD treatment into their benefit offerings through their EAP or mental health provider. However, a behavioral health strategy that doesn’t include dedicated substance-use management has significant shortcomings when it comes to efficacy and cost control. In this employer-focused webinar, we’ll explore why a leading health care system invested in dedicated substance-use management for their employees and the results they’ve achieved, focusing on cost savings, outcomes, and member engagement. This session aims to foster understanding of the complexities of SUD care and highlight the clinical and financial impact that dedicated substance-use treatment provides. 
Register now
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
July 10: Learning and Development: How New Tools Are Changing Upskilling and Career Mobility
As employers put more emphasis on skills as the currency for worker development, they’re seeking new ways to measure them, fill in gaps, and predict the skills needed in the future. How can these new tools, including AI, create better matches between employees and projects? How can employers gain insights from the data they gather? Why do real-world simulations help measure certain skills better than traditional assessments? 
Register now
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
July 17: Innovative Benefits That Support Healthy Families and Caregivers
As the pandemic’s caregiving crisis showed, employers found significant gaps in their support for the parents and other caregivers in their workforces. The resulting scramble to help has produced a wealth of new HR policies, benefit offerings, and management practices. Where is the greatest demand for support, as well as the most innovative new methods? What have been the most cost-effective ways to help caregivers of all kinds, including parents as well as “sandwich generation” workers caring for elderly and disabled relatives? 
Register now
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
August 7: Employee Engagement: Using Technology to Gain Insight Into Work Needs and Ambitions
Traditional methods like town-hall meetings and surveys can be effective, but data and well-drawn insights can give top leaders a heads up about evolving patterns and trends in their workforces. How can AI and other technology be deployed in a way that brings new insights yet still respects privacy and the individual human factors at play? What approaches will bring employers new empathy for worker needs, ambitions, and well-being? 
Register now
VIRTUAL CONFERENCE
 
August 28: Pursuing Higher Productivity With Human Factors in Mind
In a competitive and uncertain climate, most companies need to do more with less. Yet if workers are their greatest asset, employers need to make sure the push for greater output is sustainable. What is the latest thinking about how to measure productivity, the means for stimulating it, and ensuring that workers have the energy to meet their goals–as well as thrive over the long run? 
Register now

September 17: Support the Change: Why Menopause Should Be Part of Your Women’s Health Strategy
Offering solutions to improve and support needs specific to women can also be an important factor to retention. But a new survey reports that only 1% of US women have menopause support as part of their employee sponsored benefits. What’s more, according to a new survey, 85% of women said they don’t know enough about menopause, and 83% experiencing menopause report that their symptoms impact their ability to work. Join us for this webinar to learn how employers can better support women experiencing The Change, and the impact it can have on productivity, medical spend and retention. 
Register now
LIVE EVENT - HALF DAY
 
September 17: New York, NY - Benefits in 2024 and Beyond: Innovative and Inclusive Approaches for Worker Well-Being and Cost Effectiveness
A wide range of benefits allows employers to tackle a broad spectrum of their goals, spanning from retaining and engaging employees to promoting diversity and inclusion within the workplace. What are the cutting-edge benefits available that cater to the needs of every worker? How can companies evaluate their workforce needs and cultivate awareness and participation in their offerings? What trends are emerging and what can be expected in the future of benefits? 
Register
 
now

September 18: Building a Corporate Culture That Workers Can Understand, Influence and Embrace
Company culture is amorphous yet vital–the shared beliefs, values, traditions and behaviors that drive the actions of individuals and the organization as a whole. Who should be the architects of a company’s culture and how should it be designed and constructed? How should the culture be communicated, broadly and in everyday actions? body:
Adaptive learning Leader Talk, Spring magazine release and more.

THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
If we’ve learned anything so far this year, it’s that the key to achieving continuous business success relies on learning leaders’ ability to adapt and be agile in a time of constant change. That’s why it’s important for learning leaders to develop and hone their skills so they can efficaciously lead learning in the modern workplace.
To help you get started, check out:
A 
Leader Talk
 on finding success through adaptive learning to discover how adaptive learning technologies can tailor content for unique learning paths.
Training Industry Magazine's Spring Issue

Our Training Industry Research e-book, “
The Anatomy of the Modern Learning System
,” for insights on developing effective learning programs in a rapidly changing industry.
As always, we love hearing from you. Email us at 
editor@trainingindustry.com
 with any comments and suggestions.
Danielle Johnson
Associate Editor

subject: Corporate leaders revealed; INTA discusses Annual Meeting plans; USTR Special 301 released; and much more
body:
WTR SUNDAY DIGEST
28 April 2024
 
 
Corporate leaders revealed; INTA discusses Annual Meeting plans; USTR Special 301 released; and much more
 
Everything we covered on WTR over the past seven days, and all you need to know from the world of trademarks to set yourself up for the start of another busy week.
 
WTR 300: The World’s Leading Corporate Trademark Professionals
 
Discover the 
leading lights
 of the corporate trademark world in our new 
WTR 300
.
 
Monday 22 April
 
On Earth Day, representatives from Rouse explain why brands are struggling to register 
green marks
 in Southeast Asia.
 
We unpick recent instances of the EU General Court 
disagreeing with the EUIPO
.
 
Plus:
General Court: Board of Appeal correctly limited its likelihood of confusion assessment to part of the relevant public 
(European Union)
Panel gives respondent the benefit of the doubt in UDRP case
 (International)
 
Tuesday 23 April
 
This month’s 
legislation and policy watch
 sees Tennessee sign the ELVIS Act, Hong Kong reduce IP-related tax, the United States introduce new AI copyright transparency rules, and more.
 
Greggs’ brand value rises, and Pink files an opposition against Pharrell Williams, in 
Tuesday’s news digest
.
 
Plus:
Aruba Tourism Authority fails to obtain cancellation of ARUBA mark
 (Argentina)
Producer of Moët & Chandon champagne victorious in CLUB MOET dispute
 (Japan)
 
Wednesday 24 April
 
WTR chats with the co-chairs of this year’s INTA Annual Meeting to find out what the 
event has in store
 for registered participants.
 
IPONZ issues guidance on the use of Māori elements, and the EUIPO implements a common practice on objectionable marks, in this week’s 
IP office updates
.
 
We explore the processes for protecting brands on 
social media in Thailand
 – and the popular platforms to pay attention to.
 
Plus:
Delhi High Court passes summary judgment and awards costs to plaintiff in ANGSANA dispute
 (India)
Extraordinary measure implemented to revitalise economy in areas damaged by rain
 (Peru)
 
Thursday 25 April
 
The latest 
USTR Special 301 Report
 criticises the EU GI “agenda” and reiterates concerns about IP rights in Russia.
 
Foreign brand owners should not be put off by slow 
progress at the Myanmar IP department
, local experts suggest, one year after its grand opening.
 
Plus:
General Court: Board of Appeal decision breached opponent’s right to be heard
 (European Union)
Is use of a mark as a smartphone app icon use in respect of the services provided by the app?
 (South Korea)
Second Circuit denies Modelo summary judgment over ambiguous terms in licensing agreement
 (Market Insight: United States)
 
Friday 26 April
 
Barbie’s brand value
 rises, Louis Vuitton launches an NFT jacket, the Scotch Whisky Association celebrates an anti-counterfeiting raid in South Korea, and more.
 
We analyse US court 
data for Meta
, as part of a mini-series examining trademark litigation involving the Big Five tech firms.
 
Plus:
Board of Appeal applies neutralisation principle in dispute between chocolate manufacturers
 (Estonia)
General Court: no likelihood of confusion between identical marks due to dissimilarity of goods and services
 (European Union)
 
Saturday 27 April
 
Ritter Spencer Cheng’s Chelsie Spencer argues that the 
USPTO’s Lawful Use rule
 is well past its prime, in this week’s opinion column.
 
Special Report
 
WTR’s 
latest Special Report
 examines the future of 
brand protection on social media
, offering insights and strategies to help brand owners mitigate the risks and seize new opportunities for brand growth in an evolving digital world.
 
Subscribe

body:
25 April 2024 
 
Editor's Round-Up
Today, we unveil 
this year’s WTR 300
 – a 
valuable guide to
 the corporate brand professionals deemed to be leading lights of the industry. Click 
here
 to discover who has been recognised for their world-class trademark expertise and ongoing efforts to protect brands around the globe.
 
Elsewhere this week, we unpicked 
Apple’s US trademark litigation data
 to determine the company’s current success rates before the courts.
 
Other trending content:
 
Five minutes with… INTA’s Annual Meeting co-chairs 2024
 
Earth Day: why brands are struggling to register green marks in Southeast Asia
 
Social media in Thailand: what brand owners need to know
 
IP budgets forecast to rise in 2024; trademark clearance to cause headaches for in-house teams
 
Pandabuy raid update: UK police and Corsearch expand on their role, as warehouses ‘reopen’
 
Victoria Arnold-Rees
Editor
Long Read
 
Does the US SHOP SAFE Act go too far in shifting liability? 
 
In our latest opinion column, Megan Bannigan, Christopher Ford, Kate Saba and Hannah Beattie at Debevoise & Plimpton argue that the current provisions of the US SHOP SAFE Act, while well-intentioned, go too far in shifting liability onto e-commerce sites for online counterfeiting. 
Read more
Market Insight 
USA 
McDermott Will & Emery 
Second Circuit denies Modelo summary judgment over ambiguous terms in licensing agreement
 
The scope of the definition of ‘beer’ in a trademark licensing agreement has been called into question after the licensee began selling hard seltzers under the plaintiff’s brand. The court’s summary judgment denial highlights the need for specificity when it comes to defining products in such agreements. 
Authors:
Tessa Kroll 
Insight 
Allen & Overy
 
Krystyna Szczepanowska-Kozlowska
 
Poland: Amends to Civil Procedure Code Act to have Serious Impact on Enforceability
 
Featured in 
The Trademark Litigation Review 2024
 
While Poland’s new changes are beneficial for defendants as they provide more opportunities to defend against allegations of infringement, the likelihood of a preliminary injunction being granted is much lower than previously. Meanwhile, recent Supreme Court judgments have covered issues from free movement of goods and limitation periods to civil proceedings remedies. 
Read more »
 
The Legal Co Ltd
 
Panisa Suwanmatajarn
 
Thailand: Examiners’ Unique Approach to Distinctiveness Underscores Complex Registration Process
 
Featured in 
The Trademark Prosecution Review 2024
 
There are several key aspects about Thailand’s registration process that rights holders need to know, from the first-to-file system to renewals. One key element is that examiners tend to consider any abbreviated mark to be non-distinctive; the same goes for captions or descriptions of goods or services. 
Read more »

subject: Reminder: Enhance Your Workforce Planning, Recruitment, and Retention Efforts
body:
Join our webinar and gain valuable insights into aligning your HR and TA efforts, leveraging technology, and measuring effectiveness.
View in browser
 
 
 
Designing and Integrating Your HR and Talent Acquisition Strategic Blueprint
 
WEBINAR  
|  May 1  |  1 – 2 p.m. CT 
Recommended CPE: 1 CPE credit,  Personnel/Human Resources 
Register Now
 
This 
complimentary 
webinar aims to equip participants with knowledge and skills needed to develop and implement a cohesive strategic blueprint for human resources (HR) and talent acquisition (TA).  
 
By exploring the alignment of these functions with broader organizational objectives and delving into practical strategies for integrations, attendees can gain valuable insights into enhancing workforce planning and recruitment efforts for long-term success.  
 
In addition to the core learning objectives, participants will explore the role of technology and data analytics in modern HR and TA strategies. Participants can gain an understanding of key performance indicators and metrics used to assess various aspects of workforce planning, recruitment, and retention strategies. By learning how to analyze these metrics effectively, attendees will be equipped with tools to evaluate the success of their initiatives, identify areas for improvement, and make informed decisions to drive strategic outcomes within their organizations.  
 
At the end of this session, you will be able to:  
Recognize the importance of aligning HR and TA strategies with overall organizational goals 
Recall leading practices for designing and integrating HR and TA strategies 
Identify common challenges and potential improvements in designing and integrating HR and TA strategies 
Recall what you learned about leveraging technology and data analytics to enhance your HR and TA processes 
Identify methods for measuring the effectiveness and impact of HR and TA initiatives through key performance indicators and metrics 
Who should attend  
This session is designed for business owners, executives, and HR and TA leaders.

THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
With the second quarter in full swing, our editorial team at Training Industry is busy writing and publishing timely — and actionable — resources to help support your career growth. Looking to brush up on the latest trends and innovations in the corporate training market? Check out the latest

Sarah Gallo, CPTM

subject: WTR Industry Awards shortlist; Pandabuy raids updates; Weixin brand protection report; and much more
body:
WTR SUNDAY DIGEST
21 April 2024
 
 
WTR Industry Awards shortlist; Pandabuy raids updates; Weixin brand protection report; and much more
 
Everything we covered on WTR over the past seven days, and all you need to know from the world of trademarks to set yourself up for the start of another busy week.
 
Special Report
 
WTR’s 
new Special Report
 reveals what the future holds for 
brand protection on social media
, offering insights and strategies to help brand owners mitigate the risks and seize future opportunities for brand growth in an evolving digital world.
 
Monday 15 April
 
After WTR broke the news that Chinese shopping agent 
Pandabuy had been raided
 following legal action from 16 brand owners, the investigation 
continued on Monday
, with one community member claiming “nothing has hit the rep scene like this before”.
 
Meta’s battle
 for use of its name in Brazil highlights the importance of being first to file in the country.
 
We kick off our latest series of Legal Updates you may have missed by looking at cases that demonstrate the hurdles faced by 
owners of non-traditional trademarks
.
 
Plus:
Ninth Circuit: federal courts have jurisdiction to hear challenges to trademark applications
 (United States)
Reopening of investigation into famous rapper’s death raises discussions about authorship of his work
 (Venezuela)
 
Tuesday 16 April
 
Computer scientists at the University of Chicago have developed groundbreaking software that aims to help artists 
protect themselves from AI mimicry
.
 
We highlight recent 
success stories in the fashion and luxury industry
 – providing insights into parody products and the fight against counterfeit goods online. 
 
Meta expands its AI offering, the 
CHILI CRUNCH controversy
 comes to an end, Michigan cannabis companies face lawsuits, and more.
 
Plus:
Delhi High Court grants well-known status to HALDIRAM mark and raps defendants for evading proceedings
 (India)
UDRP decision highlights complexity in assessing bad-faith registration
 (International)
 
Wednesday 17 April
 
WTR reveals the in-house teams and individuals 
shortlisted for this year’s WTR Industry Awards.
 
The latest IP office updates see revisions to Saudi Arabia’s rejection procedure, discussions of a new Korea IP commissioner, Iraq modifying its payment process, 
and more
.
 
Weixin’s 
annual brand protection report
 outlines the latest enhancements to its programme and efforts to crowdsource enforcement leads. 
 
Plus:
Rimowa unsuccessful in opposition against Japanese-character mark
 (Japan)
INDECOPI issues new mandatory precedent on validity period of notoriety declarations
 (Peru)
 
Thursday 18 April
 
IP 
budgets are forecast to rise
 in 2024, but trademark clearance looks set to cause headaches for in-house teams, according to a new impact study by UnitedLex.
 
UK police and Corsearch expand on their respective roles in the Pandabuy raids, as warehouses 
begin to reopen
.
 
After examining a number of fashion and luxury trademark successes, we consider recent cases where brand owners in the industry have 
failed to defend their rights
. 
 
Plus:
Central Court of Instruction of National Court rules on admissibility of expert report on damages suffered by trademark owners
 (Spain)
VEUVE CLICQUOT v VEUVE OLIVIER: TTAB favours petitioner as respondent defaults in cancellation action
 (United States)
How to curb the risk of non-use and invalidation challenges when it comes to trademark assignment in China
 (Market Insight: China)
Delhi High Court restricts tech company from selling refurbished hard-drive disks in reverse passing off case
 (Market Insight: India)
USPTO proposes new filing rules for 2025
 (Market Insight: United States)
 
Friday 19 April
 
We unpick 
Apple’s US litigation data
 to reveal the company’s success rates fighting for its rights before the district courts and the TTAB.
 
The so-called ‘Banksy of trademarks’ reveals plans to 
run for mayor of San Francisco
, StockX issues its first anti-counterfeiting report, Casa Azul prevails in a tequila dispute, and more.
 
Plus:
General Court provides detailed assessment of bad faith in invalidity proceedings
 (European Union)
‘Deferment of announcement of verdict’ institution regulated again: potential impact for rights holders
 (Türkiye)
 
Saturday 20 April
 
This week’s opinion column argues that the current provisions of the US SHOP SAFE Act, while well-intentioned, may go too far in 
shifting counterfeiting liability onto e-commerce sites
.
 
Subscribe
Follow on
 
 
Follow on
 
 
Law Business Research 
- Registered office: Holborn Gate, 330 High Holborn, WC1V 7QT, London, United Kingdom. 
Registered in England and Wales number 03281866

 a range of industry stakeholders, including legal counsel at Christian Louboutin, Tencent/Weixin and World Wrestling Entertainment, leveraging the new techniques and partnerships identified in this report can help brand professionals to streamline enforcement efforts and swiftly respond to potential threats. This will help them to safeguard their brand assets and preserve consumer trust now and in the future.
 
Elsewhere, at the weekend WTR broke the news that multiple premises run by Chinese shopping agent 
Pandabuy had been raided
 as part of a monumental enforcement action initiated by 16 major brand owners. 
Reactions to the raids
 and subsequent takedowns of online rep forums continue to flood in, with one community member claiming “nothing has hit the rep scene like this before”.
 
Finally, WTR is pleased to reveal the 
shortlist for this year’s WTR Industry Awards
, showcasing those going above and beyond in the corporate trademark world. The winners will be announced at an exclusive ceremony in Atlanta next month.

Greek KALAMATA olive decision sets precedent for future EU GI disputes

subject: Panel Discussion on Cross-Industry Partnerships and DEIB Innovation
body:
View this email in your browser
 
Dear SIETAR Friends,
 
We are delighted to extend a special invitation to an upcoming panel discussion "
How are Cross-Industry Partnerships Enhancing the Effectiveness of DEIB Efforts in the Workplace?"
Date: April 25th 
Time: 18:00 - 19:15 CET
Together we will delve into the innovative ways partnerships across various sectors are not only enhancing but also revolutionizing Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB) strategies in today's workplaces.
Our esteemed panel of experts will explore how these collaborations are driving inclusive cultures and delivering impactful DEIB outcomes.
Meet our guest speakers:
Donna-Marie Jørgensen
Intercultural Trainer & DEIB, Founder of Culture Code
Amna Ben Amara
Researcher and Intercultural Trainer
Patricia Szobonya
Program Director of Legal Studies SUNY RCC, Associate Professor, RCC Global Institute
The panel will be moderated by 
Clair Aghassipour
, an Award-Winning Speaker and Author of 'Navigating the Culture Maze', who will share her insightful final remarks.
Key Discussion Questions
 will include:
How might multi-disciplinary and cross-cultural collaboration be perceived by a Japanese student studying at a Danish university?
What is cultural humility and how does it impact educators and students? ...and more thought-provoking inquiries.
This event promises to shed light on the future of workplace diversity and the transformative power of cross-industry partnerships. We would be honored to have you join us on
 April 25th 
to contribute to this important conversation.
  
Please register via the Link below 
Register here
 
We look forward to your participation and collaboration!
Best regards,
SIETAR Europa Member Benefits Committee

THE BUSINESS OF LEARNING™
When your job description involves learning and development (L&D), you’re not only tasked with keeping your entire workforce’s skills up to date — no small feat in 2024 — but also a variety of other essential business functions, including change management, onboarding, succession planning and more.
This week, we’re excited to bring you a new issue of 
Training Industry Magazine
. Our spring issue is packed with insights and best practices on how you can more effectively lead learning at your organization. We’re also featuring our list of 
2024’s top leadership training companies
 and articles on real-world artificial intelligence use cases, facilitating L&D for a multigenerational audience and more.
As always, we love hearing from you! Reach out with any questions, topic requests or suggestions to 
editor@trainingindustry.com
. Have a great week!
Mike Allen, CPTM
Editor 
Complimentary Conflict Intelligence Workshop
Workplace conflicts are a double-edged sword for L&D professionals. Not only do they face conflicts within their teams, but they also have to equip employees throughout the organization with the tools needed to address their own disputes. To help navigate this dual challenge, we’re thrilled to invite you to “
Developing Conflict Intelligence
,” a free virtual mini-workshop, courtesy of NextArrow. The workshop is a research-based, practical and playful experience designed explicitly for tackling challenges that every L&D professional encounters at work.

subject: INTA video debate; advice for moving to private practice; landmark US decision
body:
11 April 2024 
 
Editor's Round-Up
An INTA video posted on social media calling out professionals perceived to be 
riding on the coattails
 of the Annual Meeting sparked debate across the trademark community last week. We reflected on CEO Etienne Sanz de Acedo’s message and why the video had to be issued, despite it likely upsetting some people. Elsewhere, we sat down with two former in-house leaders – ex-AB InBev global director of legal and corporate affairs Fabio Riva and ex-FIFA head of intellectual property Daniel Zohny – to discuss their recent 
moves to private practice
, including what spurred such significant career changes and their advice for anyone considering a similar shift.

Breitling prevails with good-faith defence in Second Circuit infringement dispute ruling
 
An infringement suit brought against luxury watch retailer Breitling has shed light on the implications of using trademarks as descriptive terms. The court’s decision to grant summary judgment highlights how the good-faith prong in the fair-use defence can help when it comes to likelihood of confusion.

Delhi High Court addresses implications of legislation governing trade name changes following a finding of infringement
 
In 
Sanofi v Zanofi
, the Delhi High Court has ruled on the phonetic similarity of trademarks and trade names. In its assessment of the requirements involved in changing such names, the court clarified the interplay between the Trade Marks Act 1999 and Companies Act 2013 for the first time.
